revised_title: Muscular Contraction: X-ray Diffraction Studies on Striated and Smooth Muscles
tldr: This article discusses X-ray diffraction studies on striated and smooth muscles, focusing on the physical and chemical basis of muscular contraction. The authors explore the filament lattice of striated muscle and the role of actin and myosin filaments in muscle contraction. They also investigate the 'paramyosin' pattern in molluscan muscles and propose a model for the organization of 'paramyosin' in thick filaments.
